title.narrative: Contribution to United Nations Mine Action Service

description.narrative: The United Nations Mine Action Service (UNMAS) collaborates with 11 other UN departments, agencies, programmes and funds to ensure an effective, proactive and coordinated response to the problems of landmines and explosive remnants of war, including cluster munitions. Funding under this investments supports the provision of a grant to support to UNMAS, including supporting the monitoring and evaluation mechanism, the UNMAS Technical Advisory Team, and providing support to mine action activities in Afghanistan and Colombia. The total value of this investment is $1.8 million: of which $0.5 million to be expensed over during the 2015-16 financial year and $1.3 million to be expensed over during the 2016-17 financial year.

participating-org.narrative: Australia - Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
